column1: Rule 1: Modifiers containing both amino and carboxylic acid groups, especially when they are part of a short aliphatic chain (3-5 carbons) and the amino group is at the α or β position relative to the carboxylic acid, tend to result in high yield.
column2: Rule 2: Modifiers with a benzene ring substituted with electron-withdrawing groups such as nitro or bromomethyl tend to result in high yield.
column3: Rule 3: Modifiers with a sulfanyl group on a short aliphatic chain (3-5 carbons) tend to result in high yield.
column4: Rule 4: Modifiers with a pyridine ring, especially when not substituted with additional electron-withdrawing groups, tend to result in high yield.
column5: Rule 5: Modifiers with a formyl group on a benzene ring tend to result in low yield, unless there are electron-donating groups such as methoxy or amino groups elsewhere in the molecule that could mitigate this effect.
column6: Rule 6: Modifiers with a hydroxyphenyl group tend to result in low yield, unless there are additional electron-withdrawing groups that could enhance the yield.
column7: Rule 7: Modifiers with a trifluoroacetyl group tend to result in low yield.
column8: Rule 8: Modifiers with an oxo group adjacent to a carboxylic acid group tend to result in low yield.
column9: Rule 9: Modifiers with a long aliphatic chain (more than 6 carbons) tend to result in low yield, unless there are branching or polar groups such as hydroxyl or amino groups that could improve yield.
column10: Rule 10: Modifiers with multiple methoxy groups on a phenyl ring tend to result in high yield.
column11: Rule 11: Modifiers with an acetamido group tend to result in low yield.
column12: Rule 12: Modifiers with an indole group tend to result in high yield.
column13: Rule 13: Modifiers with a benzene ring substituted with a pyridyl group tend to result in low yield.
column14: Rule 14: Modifiers with a hydroxyl group on a benzene ring without additional electron-withdrawing groups tend to result in high yield.
column15: Rule 15: Modifiers with a benzene ring substituted with a carboxylic acid group and no additional electron-withdrawing groups tend to result in high yield.
